Detailed Description

A navigation mesh used for pathfinding.

  _start,
  _goal 
) [private]

Using A*, calculate the path between two nodes.

Parameters:
_start - The start __Node
_goal - The end __Node
Returns:
None, if no path was found, or a list of __Node (including start and end) describing the path.

  _node,
  io_path 
) [private]

Trace the parents from a node to reconstruct the path to it.

Note:
This is a recursive function.
Parameters:
_node - __Node to get path to
io_path - A list to construct the path in
Returns:
The path as a list of OGRE Vector3, with the start at index 0

def pnm.pathfinding.navigationMesh.NavigationMesh.findPath (   self,
  _start,
  _goal 
)

Find a path between two points on the mesh.

Parameters:
_start - Starting location as an OGRE Vector3.
_goal - End location as an OGRE Vector3.
Returns:
None, if no path was found, or a list of OGRE Vector3 (including start and end) describing the path.

  _point,
  _firstTri = None 
)

Test if a point is on the navigation mesh in 2D x-z plane, if so return the point on the mesh's surface.

Parameters:
_point - The OGRE Vector3 point to test.
_firstTri - The first triangle to test. (default, the first triangle)
Returns:
The position on the mesh as a OGRE Vector3 or None
